article_title: How to Cut Your Health-Care Bill: Pay Cash
article_text:
As consumers get savvier about shopping for health care, some are finding a curious trend: More hospitals, imaging centers, outpatient surgery centers and pharmacy chains will give them deep discounts if they pay cash instead of using insurance.

When Nancy Surdoval, a retired lawyer, needed a knee X-ray last year, Boulder Community Hospital in Colorado said it would cost her $600, out of pocket, using her high-deductible insurance,...

twitter.description: Hospitals and other providers increasingly are offering prices far below what they charge though insurance.
twitter.creator: @MelindaBeckWSJ

image.alt: Here’s a way to save on your health-care bill: Pay cash

twitter.title: How to Cut Your Health-Care Bill: Pay Cash
